intro: Trigonotis abata, commonly known as the white-flowered trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
